<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>REVOLVING CREDIT </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>AGREEMENT </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This <B>SECOND AMENDED AND RESTATED REVOLVING CREDIT AGREEMENT</B> (this
&#147;<U>Credit</U> <U>Agreement</U>&#148;) is made as of January&nbsp;11, 2006, by and among Barnes Group Inc. (&#147;<U>BGI</U>&#148;), a Delaware corporation having its principal place of business at 123 Main Street, P.O. Box 489, Bristol,
Connecticut 06011, Barnes Group Switzerland GmbH, Nevis Branch, a limited liability company organized under the laws of Switzerland and an indirect, wholly-owned Subsidiary of BGI having its registered office at Four Seasons Estates, Villa 1426,
Palm Grove Villas, Nevis&nbsp;&amp; Saint Kitts, West Indies (&#147;<U>Barnes Switzerland</U>&#148;, and together with BGI, the &#147;<U>Borrowers</U>&#148;, and each individually, a &#147;<U>Borrower</U>&#148;) and Bank of America, N.A., successor
by merger to Fleet National Bank (&#147;<U>Bank</U> <U>of</U> <U>America</U>&#148;), a national banking association, and the other lending institutions listed on <U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U> (the &#147;<U>Lenders</U>&#148;) and Bank of America, as
administrative agent for itself and such other lending institutions (the &#147;<U>Administrative</U> <U>Agent</U>&#148;) with Banc of America Securities LLC, as Arranger (the &#147;<U>Arranger</U>&#148;), KeyBank National Association, as Syndication
Agent (the &#147;<U>Syndication</U> <U>Agent</U>&#148;) and HSBC Bank USA National Association and Webster Bank, National Association, as Co-Documentation Agents (the &#147;<U>Documentation</U> <U>Agents</U>&#148;). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS</B>, pursuant to that certain Amended and Restated Revolving
Credit Agreement, dated as of June&nbsp;2, 2004 (as amended and in effect from time to time, the &#147;<U>Existing</U> <U>Credit</U> <U>Agreement</U>&#148;), by and among BGI, certain of the Lenders, the Administrative Agent, and certain other
parties thereto, such Lenders have made available certain financing to BGI upon the terms and conditions contained therein; and </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>WHEREAS,</B> BGI has requested, among other things, to amend and restate the Existing Credit Agreement and the Lenders are willing to amend and restate
the Existing Credit Agreement on the terms and conditions set forth herein; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>NOW THEREFORE</B>, in consideration of the foregoing premises and the mutual covenants contained herein, BGI, the Lenders and the Administrative Agent agree that as of the date hereof, the Existing Credit Agreement
shall be amended and restated in its entirety as set forth herein: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B>1. <U>DEFINITIONS AND RULES OF INTERPRETATION.</U> </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B>1.1. <U>Definitions</U>.</B> The following terms shall have the meanings set forth in this &#167;1 or elsewhere in the provisions of this Credit Agreement referred to below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Accountants</U>. PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP or any other nationally recognized independent auditors selected by BGI and
reasonably satisfactory to the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><U>Acquired Business</U>. A company or business acquired by BGI or any of its Subsidiaries (through asset purchase or otherwise) in compliance with &#167;9.5; <U>provided</U> that the company or business acquired will not be considered an
Acquired Business until (a)&nbsp;BGI has delivered to the Administrative Agent historical financial statements of such company or business prepared in accordance with GAAP, an officer&#146;s certificate pursuant to &#167;9.5.1(a) and such other
financial information reasonably requested by the Administrative Agent and (b)&nbsp;the Administrative Agent has consented in writing to the designation of such acquired company or business as an Acquired Business, such consent not to be
unreasonably withheld or delayed. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Adjustment Date</U>. The
first day of the month immediately following the month in which a Compliance Certificate is to be delivered by the Borrowers pursuant to &#167;8.4(c). </FONT></P>



<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Administrative Agent</U>. Bank of America, N.A., acting as agent for the Lenders and each other Person
appointed as the successor Administrative Agent in accordance with &#167;14.9. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Administrative Agent&#146;s Office</U>. The Administrative Agent&#146;s office located at 100 Federal Street, Boston, Massachusetts 02110, or at such other location as the Administrative Agent may designate from
time to time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Administrative Agent&#146;s Special
Counsel</U>. Bingham McCutchen LLP, or such other counsel as may be approved by the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Administrative Questionnaire</U>. An Administrative Questionnaire in a form supplied by the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Affiliate</U>. (a)&nbsp;When used generally, with respect to any Person,
another Person that directly, or indirectly through one or more intermediaries, Controls or is Controlled by or is under common Control with the Person specified, and (b)&nbsp;when used with respect to the Borrowers, any Person that would be
considered to be an affiliate of BGI under Rule 144(a) of the Rules and Regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission, as in effect on the date hereof, if BGI were issuing securities. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Amendment Fee</U>. See &#167;11.7. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Applicable Margin</U>. For each period commencing on an Adjustment Date
through the date immediately preceding the next Adjustment Date (each a &#147;<U>Rate</U> <U>Adjustment</U> <U>Period</U>&#148;), the Applicable Margin shall be the applicable margin set forth below with respect to the Leverage Ratio, as determined
for the four (4)&nbsp;consecutive fiscal quarters then ending of BGI and its Subsidiaries ending on the last day of the fiscal quarter ended immediately prior to the applicable Rate Adjustment Period. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Borrowers fail
to deliver any Compliance Certificate pursuant to &#167;8.4(c) hereof, then for the period commencing on the next Adjustment Date to occur subsequent to such failure through the date immediately following the date on which such Compliance
Certificate is delivered, the Applicable Margin shall be the highest Applicable Margin set forth above. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Applicable Pension Legislation</U>. At any time, any pension or retirement benefits legislation (be it national, federal, provincial, territorial or
otherwise) then applicable to any Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><U>Approved Fund</U>. Any Fund that is administered or managed by (a)&nbsp;a Lender, (b)&nbsp;an Affiliate of a Lender or (c)&nbsp;an entity or an Affiliate of an entity that administers or manages a Lender. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-2- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Arranger</U>. Banc of America Securities LLC. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Assignment and Assumption</U>. See &#167;15.1. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Attributable Debt</U>. In respect of a sale and leaseback transaction, at
the time of determination, the present value (discounted at the rate of interest implicit in such transaction, determined in accordance with GAAP) of the obligation of the lessee for net rental payments during the remaining term of the lease
included in such sale and leaseback transaction (including any period for which such lease has been extended or may, at the option of the lessor, be extended). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Auto-Extension Letter of Credit</U>. See &#167;4.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Balance Sheet Date</U>. December&nbsp;31, 2004. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Bank of America</U>. Bank of America, N.A., a national banking association, in its individual capacity. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Barnes Switzerland</U>. Barnes Group Switzerland GmbH, a corporation
organized under the laws of Switzerland and an indirect, wholly-owned Subsidiary of BGI. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Barnes Switzerland Loans</U>. Revolving Credit Loans made or to be made by the Lenders to Barnes Switzerland pursuant to &#167;2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Barnes Switzerland Obligations</U>. All Obligations of Barnes Switzerland with respect to the Barnes Switzerland Loans.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Barnes Switzerland Sublimit</U>. Fifty percent
(50%)&nbsp;of the Total Commitment as in effect from time to time, or such other percentage of the Total Commitment as requested in writing by the Borrowers, consented to in writing by the Administrative Agent in its sole discretion, and
communicated to the Lenders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Base Rate</U>. The higher of
(a)&nbsp;the variable annual rate of interest so designated from time to time by Bank of America at its office in Charlotte, North Carolina, as its &#147;prime rate&#148;, such rate being a reference rate and not necessarily representing the lowest
or best rate being charged to any customer, and (b)&nbsp;one-half of one percent (1/2%)&nbsp;above the Federal Funds Effective Rate. For the purposes of this definition, &#147;<U>Federal</U> <U>Funds</U> <U>Effective</U> <U>Rate</U>&#148; shall mean
for any day, the rate per annum equal to the weighted average of the rates on overnight federal funds transactions with members of the Federal Reserve System arranged by federal funds brokers on such day, as published on the Business Day next
succeeding such day (or, if such day is not a Business Day, for the next preceding Business Day) by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, or, if such rate is not so published for any Business Day, the Federal Funds Effective Rate for any such day
shall be the average rate per annum (rounded upward, if necessary, to a whole multiple of 1/100 of 1%) charged to Bank of America on such day on such transactions as determined by the Administrative Agent. Changes in the Base Rate resulting from any
changes in Bank of America&#146;s &#147;<U>prime</U> <U>rate</U>&#148; shall take place immediately without notice or demand of any kind. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Base Rate Loans</U>. Loans bearing interest calculated by reference to the Base Rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>BGI</U>. Barnes Group Inc., a Delaware corporation. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-3- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>BGI Guaranty</U>. The guaranty dated as of the date hereof executed pursuant to &#167;6.2 in favor of
the Administrative Agent and the Lenders, of the payment and performance of the Barnes Switzerland Obligations in the form of <U>Exhibit</U> <U>F</U> attached hereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>BGI Loans</U>. Revolving Credit Loans other than the Barnes Switzerland Loans. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Borrower(s)</U>. As defined in the preamble hereto. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Borrower Materials</U>. See &#167;8.4. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Business Day</U>. Any day on which banking institutions in New York, New
York are open for the transaction of banking business and, in the case of LIBOR Rate Loans, also a day which is a LIBOR Business Day. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Capitalized Leases</U>. Leases under which BGI or any of its Subsidiaries is the lessee or obligor, the discounted future rental payment obligations
under which are required to be capitalized on the balance sheet of the lessee or obligor in accordance with GAAP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Capital Stock</U>. Any and all shares, interests, participations or other equivalents (however designated) of capital stock of a corporation, any and
all equivalent ownership interests in a Person (other than a corporation) and any and all warrants, rights or options to purchase any of the foregoing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Change of Control</U>. If (a)&nbsp;any Person or group of Persons (as used in Sections 13 and 14 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended,
and the rules and regulations thereunder) shall have become the beneficial owner (as defined in Rules 13d-3 and 13d-5 promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission under said Act) of thirty percent (30%)&nbsp;or more of BGI&#146;s
outstanding Voting Stock; <U>provided</U>, however, that members of the Barnes family, Bank of America and any of its Affiliates (to the extent that it owns stock in which a member of the Barnes family has an interest), the Barnes Group Inc.
Retirement Savings Plan and Fidelity Management Trust Company, in its capacity as trustee under such plan, and employees of BGI (except employees of BGI who became beneficial owners of more than ten percent (10%)&nbsp;of BGI&#146;s Voting Stock
prior to becoming employees of BGI) shall not be counted as a Person for purposes hereof, or (b)&nbsp;a &#147;change of control&#148; occurs under the other Existing Senior Debt, or any future Indebtedness, or (c)&nbsp;BGI fails to own 100% of the
stock of Barnes Switzerland except for any nominal interest (5% or less) required to be held by a third party. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Closing Date</U>. The first date on which the conditions set forth in &#167;11 have been satisfied, and all &#147;<U>Loans</U>&#148; under and as
defined in the Existing Credit Agreement are converted into Loans hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Code</U>. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Commitment</U>. With respect to each Lender, the amount set forth on <U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U> hereto as the amount of such Lender&#146;s commitment to make Loans to, and to participate in the issuance,
extension and renewal of Letters of Credit for the account of, the Borrowers or either of them, as the same may be reduced from time to time; or if such commitment is terminated pursuant to the provisions hereof, zero. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Commitment Percentage</U>. With respect to each Lender, the percentage set
forth on <U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U> hereto as such Lender&#146;s percentage of the aggregate Commitments of all of the Lenders. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Compliance Certificate</U>. See &#167;8.4(c). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-4- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated or consolidated</U>. With reference to any term defined herein, shall mean that term as
applied to the accounts of BGI and its Subsidiaries, consolidated in accordance with GAAP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Cash Interest Expense</U>. As of the last day of any fiscal quarter, the amount of interest expense, paid or payable in cash, of the Borrowers, their Subsidiaries, and Acquired Businesses (to the
extent that such Acquired Business is included in the calculation of Consolidated EBITDA for such period), for the four fiscal quarters ended on such date, determined on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP for such period. Except to the
extent approved by the Administrative Agent, all Indebtedness assumed to have been incurred by the Acquired Businesses shall be deemed to have borne interest at a rate no less than the sum of (a)&nbsp;the arithmetic mean of (x)&nbsp;the LIBOR Rate
for LIBOR Rate Loans having an Interest Period of one month in effect on the first day of the four (4)&nbsp;consecutive fiscal quarters then ending and (y)&nbsp;the LIBOR Rate for LIBOR Rate Loans having an Interest Period of one month in effect on
the last day of the four (4)&nbsp;consecutive fiscal quarters then ending <U>plus</U> (b)&nbsp;the Applicable Margin for Loans then in effect (after giving effect to such acquisition on a pro forma basis). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated EBITDA</U>. For any period, Consolidated Net Income of the
Borrowers, their Subsidiaries and, without duplication, the Acquired Businesses (excluding, without duplication, (a)&nbsp;extraordinary gains and losses in accordance with GAAP, (b)&nbsp;gains and losses in connection with asset dispositions whether
or not constituting extraordinary gains and losses, and (c)&nbsp;gains or losses on discontinued operations) for the four fiscal quarters ended on such date, plus (i)&nbsp;Consolidated Cash Interest Expense of the Borrowers, their Subsidiaries and,
without duplication, the Acquired Businesses for such period, plus (ii)&nbsp;to the extent deducted in computing such Consolidated Net Income of the Borrowers, their Subsidiaries and, without duplication, the Acquired Businesses, the sum of income
taxes, depreciation and amortization for such period. The financial results of any Acquired Businesses acquired at any time during the period tested shall be included as if such Acquired Business had been acquired as of the first day of the period
tested. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Net Income</U>. The consolidated net
income (or deficit) of BGI and its Subsidiaries, after deduction of all expenses, taxes, and other proper charges, determined in accordance with GAAP (excluding any losses attributable to the use of a fair value methodology for recognition and
measurement of impairment of goodwill identified in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board Statement No.&nbsp;142). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Net Worth</U>. The excess of Consolidated Total Assets over Consolidated Total Liabilities (excluding any non-cash other comprehensive
income adjustments made in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board Statements No.&nbsp;52 and No.&nbsp;87). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Senior Debt</U>. Consolidated Total Debt <U>less</U> the outstanding amount of any Subordinated Debt. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Tangible Assets</U>. Consolidated Total Assets at any time
less, (a)&nbsp;patents, copyrights, trademarks, trade names, service marks, brand names, franchises, goodwill, experimental expenses and other similar intangibles, (b)&nbsp;unamortized debt discount and expense; and (c)&nbsp;all other property which
would be classified as intangible under GAAP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated
Total Assets</U>. All assets of BGI and its Subsidiaries determined on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Total Debt</U>. With respect to BGI and its Subsidiaries, the sum, without duplication, of (a)&nbsp;the aggregate amount of Indebtedness
of BGI and its Subsidiaries, on a consolidated basis, outstanding on such date for borrowed money or the deferred purchase price of property including, </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-5- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">without limitation, in respect of any Synthetic Leases or any Capitalized Leases, <U>plus</U> (b)&nbsp;Indebtedness of the type referred to in clause
(a)&nbsp;of another Person (not including BGI or its Subsidiaries) guaranteed by BGI or its Subsidiaries. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Consolidated Total Liabilities</U>. All liabilities of BGI and its Subsidiaries determined on a consolidated basis in accordance with GAAP and
classified as such on the consolidated balance sheet of BGI and its Subsidiaries. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Control</U>. The possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of a Person, whether through the ability to exercise voting power, by contract or
otherwise. &#147;<U>Controlling</U>&#148; and &#147;<U>Controlled</U>&#148; have meanings correlative thereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Conversion Request</U>. A notice given by a Borrower to the Administrative Agent of the Borrower&#146;s election to convert or continue a Loan in
accordance with &#167;2.7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Credit Agreement</U>. This
Second Amended and Restated Revolving Credit Agreement, including the Schedules and Exhibits hereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Debtor Relief Laws</U>. The Bankruptcy Code of the United States, and all other liquidation, conservatorship, bankruptcy, assignment for the benefit of
creditors, moratorium, rearrangement, receivership, insolvency, reorganization, or similar debtor relief Laws of the United States or other applicable jurisdictions from time to time in effect and affecting the rights of creditors generally.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Default</U>. See &#167;13.1. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Delinquent Lender</U>. See &#167;14.5.3. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Distribution</U>. The declaration or payment of any dividend on or in
respect of any shares of any class of Capital Stock of a Person, other than dividends payable solely in shares of common stock of such Person; the purchase, redemption, defeasance, retirement or other acquisition of any shares of any class of
Capital Stock of a Person, directly or indirectly through a Subsidiary of such Person or otherwise (including the setting apart of assets for a sinking or other analogous fund to be used for such purpose); the return of capital by a Person to its
shareholders as such; or any other distribution on or in respect of any shares of any class of Capital Stock of such Person. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Dollars</U> or <U>$</U>. Dollars in lawful currency of the United States of America. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Domestic Lending Office</U>. Initially, the office of each Lender designated as such in <U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U>
hereto; thereafter, such other office of such Lender, if any, located within the United States that will be making or maintaining Base Rate Loans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Drawdown Date</U>. The date on which any Loan is made or is to be made, and the date on which any Loan is converted or continued in accordance with
&#167;2.7. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Eligible</U> <U>Assignee</U>. Any of (a)&nbsp;a
Lender; (b)&nbsp;an Affiliate of a Lender; and (c)&nbsp;any other Person (other than a natural person) approved by (i)&nbsp;the Administrative Agent, the Issuing Bank and Swing Line Lender, and (ii)&nbsp;unless an Event of Default has occurred and
is continuing, BGI (each such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed); <U>provided</U> that notwithstanding the foregoing, &#147;Eligible Assignee&#148; shall not include the Borrowers or any of the Borrowers&#146; Affiliates.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-6- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Employee Benefit Plan</U>. Any employee benefit plan within the meaning of &#167;3(3) of ERISA
maintained or contributed to by any Borrower or any ERISA Affiliate, other than a Guaranteed Pension Plan or a Multiemployer Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Environmental Laws</U>. Any and all Federal, provincial, state, local and foreign statutes, law, regulations, ordinances, rules, judgments, orders,
decrees, permits, concessions, grants, franchises, licenses, agreements or governmental restrictions relating to health, safety or the environment, including but not limited to, the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act (&#147;RCRA&#148;), the
Comprehensive Environmental Response Compensation and Liability Act of 1980 as amended (&#147;CERCLA&#148;), the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act of 1986 (&#147;SARA&#148;), the Federal Clean Water Act, the Federal Clean Air Act and the
Toxic Substances Control Act. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>ERISA</U>. The Employee
Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>ERISA
Affiliate</U>. Any Person which is treated as a single employer with any of the Borrowers under &#167;414 of the Code. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>ERISA Reportable Event</U>. A reportable event with respect to a Guaranteed Pension Plan within the meaning of &#167;4043 of ERISA and the regulations
promulgated thereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Eurocurrency Reserve Rate</U>. For
any day with respect to a LIBOR Rate Loan, the maximum rate (expressed as a decimal) at which any bank subject thereto would be required to maintain reserves under Regulation D of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (or any
successor or similar regulations relating to such reserve requirements) against &#147;<U>Eurocurrency</U> <U>Liabilities</U>&#148; (as that term is used in Regulation D), if such liabilities were outstanding. The Eurocurrency Reserve Rate shall be
adjusted automatically on and as of the effective date of any change in the Eurocurrency Reserve Rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Event of Default</U>. See &#167;13.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Existing Credit Agreement</U>. As defined in the preamble hereto. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Existing Letters of Credit</U>. See &#167;17.1. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Existing Senior Debt</U>. Indebtedness of BGI and its Subsidiaries in existence as of the Closing Date and listed on
<U>Schedule</U> <U>9.1</U> hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Existing Senior
Notes</U>. The senior notes included in Existing Senior Debt and listed as items 1 through 3 on <U>Schedule</U> <U>9.1</U> hereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Facility Fee</U>. See &#167;2.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Fee Letter</U>. The fee letter dated December&nbsp;16, 2005 among the Borrowers, the Administrative Agent and the Arranger. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Fees</U>. Collectively, the Facility Fee, the Letter of Credit Fees, the
Administrative Agent&#146;s Fee, the Amendment Fee and the closing fees paid to the Lenders to obtain their commitments hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Financial Affiliate</U>. A Subsidiary of the bank holding company controlling any Lender, which Subsidiary is engaging in any of the activities
permitted by &#167;4(e) of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 (12 U.S.C. &#167;1843). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-7- </FONT></P>

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>GAAP or generally accepted accounting principles</U>. (a)&nbsp;When used in &#167;10, whether directly
or indirectly through reference to a capitalized term used therein, means (i)&nbsp;principles that are consistent with the principles promulgated or adopted by the Financial Accounting Standards Board and its predecessors, in effect on the Closing
Date, and (ii)&nbsp;to the extent consistent with such principles, the accounting practice of BGI, and (b)&nbsp;when used in general, other than as provided above, means principles that are (i)&nbsp;consistent with the principles promulgated or
adopted by the Financial Accounting Standards Board and its predecessors, as in effect from time to time, and (ii)&nbsp;consistently applied with past financial statements of BGI applying the same principles. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Gibraltar Subsidiary</U>. Barnes Group Gibraltar Limited, a corporation
organized under the Laws of Gibraltar and an indirect, wholly-owned Subsidiary of BGI. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Governing Documents</U>. With respect to any Person, its certificate or articles of incorporation, its by-laws and all shareholder agreements, voting trusts and similar arrangements applicable to any of its Capital
Stock. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Governmental Authority</U>. Any foreign, federal,
state, regional, local, municipal or other government, or any department, commission, board, bureau, agency, public authority or instrumentality thereof, or any court or arbitrator. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Guaranteed Pension Plan</U>. Any employee pension benefit plan within the meaning of &#167;3(2) of ERISA maintained or
contributed to by any Borrower or any ERISA Affiliate the benefits of which are guaranteed on termination in full or in part by the PBGC pursuant to Title IV of ERISA, other than a Multiemployer Plan. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Guarantor</U>. Collectively, all of, and individually, any of (a)&nbsp;as
set forth in the BGI Guaranty, BGI, and (b)&nbsp;each Subsidiary or Acquired Business that enters into a Guaranty in favor of the Lenders and the Administrative Agent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Guaranty</U>. The guaranty dated as of the date required by &#167;6.1 from each Person required to become a Guarantor
pursuant to &#167;6.1 in favor of the Administrative Agent and the Lenders, in each case of the payment and performance of the Obligations in the form of <U>Exhibit</U> <U>E</U> attached hereto. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Hazardous Substances</U>. See &#167;7.15(b). </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Honor Date</U>. See &#167;4.3. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Indebtedness</U>. As to any Person and whether recourse is secured by or
is otherwise available against all or only a portion of the assets of such Person and whether or not contingent, but without duplication: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) all indebtedness arising from borrowed money and similar monetary obligations, whether direct or indirect; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) all indebtedness of others secured by any mortgage,
pledge, security interest, lien, charge, or other encumbrance existing on property owned by such Person or any of its Subsidiaries or acquired by such Person or any of its Subsidiaries subject thereto, whether or not the Indebtedness secured thereby
shall have been assumed; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-8- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) all indebtedness for the deferred purchase price of property or services (other than
current trade liabilities incurred in the ordinary course of business and payable in accordance with customary practices and accrued expenses incurred in the ordinary course of business); </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d) all Attributable Debt of such Person with respect to
sale and leaseback transactions of such Person; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(e) all guarantees, endorsements and other contingent obligations, in respect of Indebtedness of others, including (i)&nbsp;any obligation to supply funds to or in any manner to invest in, directly or indirectly, the debtor, to purchase
Indebtedness, or to insure the owner of Indebtedness against loss, through an agreement to purchase goods, supplies or services for the purpose of enabling the debtor to make payment of the Indebtedness held by such owner or otherwise, (ii)&nbsp;any
obligation of any partnership in which such Person or any of its Subsidiaries is a general partner and (iii)&nbsp;any obligation to maintain working capital, equity capital or other financial statement condition or liquidity of the primary obligor
so as to enable the primary obligor to pay such primary obligation; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(f) the obligations to reimburse the issuer in respect of any letters of credit; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(g) every obligation of such Person under any Capitalized Lease; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(h) every obligation of such Person under any Synthetic Lease; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i) all sales by such Person, other than the sale or
discounting of receivables in the ordinary course of business in connection with the collection thereof, of (i)&nbsp;accounts for money due or to become due, (ii)&nbsp;chattel paper, instruments or documents creating or evidencing a right to payment
of money or (iii)&nbsp;other receivables (collectively &#147;<U>receivables</U>&#148;) and; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(j) every obligation of such Person under any forward contract, futures contract, swap, option or other financing agreement or arrangement
(including, without limitation, caps, floors, collars and similar agreements), the settlement value of which is dependent upon interest rates, currency exchange rates, commodities or other indices (a &#147;<U>Derivative</U> <U>Contract</U>&#148;).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The &#147;<U>amount</U>&#148; or &#147;<U>principal</U>
<U>amount</U>&#148; of any Indebtedness at any time of determination represented by (t)&nbsp;any Indebtedness, issued at a price that is less than the principal amount at maturity thereof, shall be the amount of the liability in respect thereof
determined in accordance with GAAP, (u)&nbsp;any Capitalized Lease shall be the principal component of the aggregate of the rental obligations under such Capitalized Lease payable over the term thereof that is not subject to termination by the
lessee, (v)&nbsp;any sale of receivables shall be the amount of unrecovered capital or principal investment of the purchaser (other than BGI or any of BGI&#146;s wholly-owned Subsidiaries) thereof, excluding amounts representative of yield or
interest earned on such investment, (w)&nbsp;any Synthetic Lease shall be the stipulated loss value, termination value or other equivalent amount, (x)&nbsp;any derivative contract shall be the maximum amount of any termination or loss payment
required to be paid by such Person if such derivative contract were, at the time of determination, to be terminated by reason of any event of default or early termination event thereunder, whether or not such event of default or early termination
event has in fact occurred, (y)&nbsp;any equity related purchase obligation shall be the maximum fixed redemption or purchase price thereof inclusive of any accrued and unpaid dividends to be comprised in such redemption or purchase price and
(z)&nbsp;any guaranty or other contingent liability referred to in clause (i)&nbsp;shall be an amount equal to the stated or determinable amount of the primary obligation in respect of which such guaranty or other contingent obligation is made or,
if not stated or determinable, the maximum reasonably anticipated liability in </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-9- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">respect thereof (assuming such Person is required to perform thereunder) as determined by such Person in good faith. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Indemnified Party</U>. See &#167;14.7. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Indemnitee</U>. See &#167;16.3. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Ineligible Securities</U>. Securities which may not be underwritten or
dealt in by member banks of the Federal Reserve System under Section&nbsp;16 of the Banking Act of 1933 (12 U.S.C. &#167;24, Seventh), as amended. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Intercreditor Agreement</U>. That certain Sharing Agreement, dated as of the Closing Date, executed and delivered by the Administrative Agent, the
Lenders party thereto, other lenders to foreign Subsidiaries party from time to time thereto, the holders of Existing Senior Notes, and the Borrowers. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Interest Payment Date</U>. (a)&nbsp;As to any Base Rate Loan, the last day of the calendar quarter with respect to interest accrued during such
calendar quarter, including, without limitation, the calendar quarter which includes the Drawdown Date of such Base Rate Loan; and (b)&nbsp;as to any LIBOR Rate Loan in respect of which the Interest Period is (i)&nbsp;3 months or less, the last day
of such Interest Period and (ii)&nbsp;more than 3 months, the date that is 3 months from the first day of such Interest Period and, in addition, the last day of such Interest Period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Interest Period</U>. With respect to each Loan, (a)&nbsp;initially, the period commencing on the Drawdown Date of such
Loan and ending on the last day of one of the periods set forth below, as selected by a Borrower in a Loan Request or as otherwise required by the terms of this Credit Agreement (i)&nbsp;for any Base Rate Loan, the last day of the calendar quarter;
and (ii)&nbsp;for any LIBOR Rate Loan, 1, 2, 3, or 6 months; and (b)&nbsp;thereafter, each period commencing on the last day of the next preceding Interest Period applicable to such Loan and ending on the last day of one of the periods set forth
above, as selected by a Borrower in a Conversion Request; <U>provided</U> that all of the foregoing provisions relating to Interest Periods are subject to the following: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(A) if any Interest Period with respect to a LIBOR Rate Loan would otherwise end on a day that is not a
LIBOR Business Day, that Interest Period shall be extended to the next succeeding LIBOR Business Day unless the result of such extension would be to carry such Interest Period into another calendar month, in which event such Interest Period shall
end on the immediately preceding LIBOR Business Day; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">(B) if any Interest Period with respect to a Base Rate Loan would end on a day that is not a Business Day, that Interest Period shall end on the next succeeding Business Day; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(C) if a Borrower shall fail to give notice as provided in &#167;2.7, such Borrower shall be deemed to have
requested a conversion of the affected LIBOR Rate Loan to a Base Rate Loan and the continuance of all Base Rate Loans as Base Rate Loans on the last day of the then current Interest Period with respect thereto; </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(D) any Interest Period relating to any LIBOR Rate Loan that
begins on the last LIBOR Business Day of a calendar month (or on a day for which there is no numerically corresponding day in the calendar month at the end of such Interest Period) shall end on the last LIBOR Business Day of a calendar month; and
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-10- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(E) any Interest Period that would otherwise extend beyond the Loan Maturity Date shall
end on the Loan Maturity Date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Investments</U>. All
expenditures made and all liabilities incurred (contingently or otherwise) for the acquisition of stock or Indebtedness of, or for loans, advances, capital contributions or transfers of property to, or in respect of any guaranties (or other
commitments as described under Indebtedness), or obligations of, any Person. In determining the aggregate amount of Investments outstanding at any particular time: (a)&nbsp;the amount of any Investment represented by a guaranty shall be taken at not
less than the principal amount of the obligations guaranteed and still outstanding; (b)&nbsp;there shall be deducted in respect of each such Investment any amount received as a return of capital (but only by repurchase, redemption, retirement,
repayment, liquidating dividend or liquidating distribution); (c)&nbsp;there shall not be deducted in respect of any Investment any amounts received as earnings on such Investment, whether as dividends, interest or otherwise; and (d)&nbsp;there
shall not be deducted from the aggregate amount of Investments any decrease in the value thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>ISP</U>. With respect to any Letter of Credit, the &#147;International Standby Practices 1998&#148; published by the Institute of International Banking
Law&nbsp;&amp; Practice (or such later version thereof as may be in effect at the time of issuance). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Issuer Documents</U>. With respect to a Letter of Credit, the Letter of Credit Application, and any other document, agreement and instrument entered
into by the Letter of Credit Issuer and any of the Borrowers (or any of their Subsidiaries) or in favor of the Letter of Credit Issuer and relating to such Letter of Credit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Issuing Bank</U>. Bank of America. The Issuing Bank may arrange, with the consent of the Borrowers, for one or more
Letters of Credit to be issued by the Issuing Bank&#146;s Affiliates, in which case the term &#147;Issuing Bank&#148; shall include any such Affiliate with respect to Letters of Credit issued by such Affiliate. Nothing herein shall be deemed to
restrict the right of the Issuing Bank to issue letters of credit outside of this Credit Agreement. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Laws</U>. Collectively, all international, foreign, Federal, state and local statutes, treaties, rules, guidelines, regulations, ordinances, codes and
administrative or judicial precedents or authorities, including the interpretation or administration thereof by any Governmental Authority charged with the enforcement, interpretation or administration thereof, and all applicable administrative
orders, directed duties, requests, licenses, authorizations and permits of, and agreements with, any Governmental Authority, in each case whether or not having the force of law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Lender Affiliate</U>. (a)&nbsp;With respect to any Lender, (i)&nbsp;an Affiliate of such Lender or (ii)&nbsp;any entity
(whether a corporation, partnership, limited liability company, trust or legal entity) that is engaged in making, purchasing, holding or otherwise investing in bank loans and similar extensions of credit in the ordinary course of its business and is
administered or managed by such Lender or an Affiliate of such Lender and (b)&nbsp;with respect to any Lender that is a fund which invests in bank loans and similar extensions of credit, any other entity (whether a corporation, partnership, limited
liability company, trust or other legal entity) that is a fund that invests in bank loans and similar extensions of credit and is managed by the same investment advisor as such Lender or by an Affiliate of such investment advisor. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Lenders</U>. Bank of America and the other lending institutions listed on
<U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U> hereto and any other Person who becomes an assignee of any rights and obligations of a Lender pursuant to &#167;15. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit</U>. Standby and documentary letters of credit issued hereunder. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-11- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Advance</U>. With respect to each Lender, such Lender&#146;s funding of its
participation in any Letter of Credit Borrowing in accordance with its Commitment Percentage. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Application</U>. An application and agreement for the issuance or amendment of a Letter of Credit in the form from time to time in use by the Issuing Bank. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Borrowing</U>. An extension of credit resulting from a
drawing under any Letter of Credit which has not been reimbursed on the date when made or refinanced as a Revolving Credit Loan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Credit Extension</U>. With respect to any Letter of Credit, the issuance thereof or extension of the expiry date thereof, or the
increase of the amount thereof. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Expiration
Date</U>. With respect to Letters of Credit, an expiry date no later than the date which is the earlier of (i)&nbsp;one-year after the issuance thereof (provided that such Letter of Credit may contain customary &#147;evergreen&#148; provisions) and
(ii)&nbsp;fourteen (14)&nbsp;days (or, if the Letter of Credit is confirmed by a confirmer or otherwise provides for one or more nominated persons, forty-five (45)&nbsp;days) prior to the Loan Maturity Date. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Fee</U>. See &#167;4.10. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Obligations</U>. As at any date of determination, the
aggregate undrawn amount of all outstanding Letters of Credit plus the aggregate of all Unpaid Reimbursement Obligations, including all Letter of Credit Borrowings. For purposes of computing the amount available to be drawn under any Letter of
Credit, the amount of such Letter of Credit shall be determined in accordance with &#167;1.3. For all purposes of this Credit Agreement, if on any date of determination a Letter of Credit has expired by its terms but any amount may still be drawn
thereunder by reason of the operation of Rule 3.14 of the ISP, such Letter of Credit shall be deemed to be &#147;outstanding&#148; in the amount so remaining available to be drawn. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Letter of Credit Participation</U>. See &#167;4.1.5. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Leverage Ratio</U>. See &#167;10.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>LIBOR Business Day</U>. Any day on which commercial banks are open for international business (including dealings in
Dollar deposits) in London or such other eurodollar interbank market as may be selected by the Administrative Agent in its sole discretion acting in good faith. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>LIBOR Lending Office</U>. Initially, the office of each Lender designated as such in <U>Schedule</U>&nbsp;<U>1</U> hereto; thereafter, such other
office of such Lender, if any, that shall be making or maintaining LIBOR Rate Loans. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>LIBOR Rate</U>. For any Interest Period with respect to a LIBOR Rate Loan, a rate per annum determined by the Administrative Agent pursuant to the following formula: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="50%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="85%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">LIBOR&nbsp;Rate&nbsp;=</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" NOWRAP ALIGN="center"> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Eurodollar&nbsp;Base&nbsp;Rate</U></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.00&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Eurodollar&nbsp;Reserve&nbsp;Percentage</FONT></P></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Where,</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-12- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Eurodollar Base Rate</U>&#148; means, for such Interest Period (rounded upwards,
as necessary, to the nearest 1/100 of 1%) the rate per annum equal to the British Bankers Association LIBOR Rate (&#147;<U>BBA LIBOR</U>&#148;), as published by Reuters (or other commercially available source providing quotations of BBA LIBOR as
designated by the Administrative Agent from time to time) at approximately 11:00 a.m., London time, two Business Days prior to the commencement of such Interest Period, for Dollar deposits (for delivery on the first day of such Interest Period) with
a term equivalent to such Interest Period. If such rate is not available at such time for any reason, then the &#147;<U>Eurodollar Base Rate</U>&#148; for such Interest Period (rounded upwards, as necessary, to the nearest 1/100 of 1%) shall be the
rate per annum determined by the Administrative Agent to be the rate at which deposits in Dollars for delivery on the first day of such Interest Period in same day funds in the approximate amount of the LIBOR Rate Loan being made, continued or
converted by Bank of America and with a term equivalent to such Interest Period would be offered by Bank of America&#146;s London Branch to major banks in the London interbank eurodollar market at their request at approximately 11:00 a.m. (London
time) two Business Days prior to the commencement of such Interest Period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#147;<U>Eurodollar Reserve Percentage</U>&#148; means, for any day during any Interest Period, the reserve percentage (expressed as a decimal, carried out to five decimal places) in effect on such day, whether or not
applicable to any Lender, under regulations issued from time to time by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System of the United States for determining the maximum reserve requirement (including any emergency, supplemental or other
marginal reserve requirement) with respect to Eurocurrency funding (currently referred to as &#147;Eurocurrency Liabilities&#148;). The LIBOR Rate for each outstanding LIBOR Rate Loan shall be adjusted automatically as of the effective date of any
change in the Eurodollar Reserve Percentage. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>LIBOR Rate
Loans</U>. Loans bearing interest calculated by reference to the LIBOR Rate. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Lien</U>. Any mortgage, deed of trust, security interest, pledge, hypothecation, assignment, attachment, deposit arrangement, encumbrance, lien (statutory, judgment or otherwise), or other security agreement or
preferential arrangement of any kind or nature whatsoever (including any conditional sale or other title retention agreement, any Capitalized Lease, any Synthetic Lease, any financing lease involving substantially the same economic effect as any of
the foregoing and the filing of any financing statement under the UCC or comparable law of any jurisdiction). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Loan(s)</U>. The Revolving Credit Loan(s) made by the Lenders to the Borrowers pursuant to &#167;2, including the Swing Line Loans advanced by the
Swing Line Lender under &#167;2.6.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Loan Documents</U>.
This Credit Agreement, the Notes, the Guaranties, the BGI Guaranty, the Letter of Credit Applications, and the Letters of Credit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Loan Parties</U>. Collectively, the Borrowers and each other Person (other than the Administrative Agent, the Issuing Bank, or any Lender) executing a
Loan Document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Loan Request</U>. See &#167;2.6. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Loan Maturity Date</U>. January&nbsp;11, 2011. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Luxembourg Subsidiaries</U>. Barnes Group Luxembourg (No. 1) S.A. and
Barnes Group Luxembourg (No. 2) S.A., each a corporation organized under the Laws of Luxembourg, and wholly-owned Subsidiaries of BGI. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-13- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Material Adverse Effect</U>. With respect to any event or occurrence of whatever nature (including any
adverse determination in any litigation, arbitration or governmental investigation or proceeding): </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a) a material adverse effect on the business, properties, condition (financial or otherwise), assets, operations or income of any of BGI,
individually, or BGI and its Subsidiaries, taken as a whole; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b) an adverse effect on the ability of any of BGI or any other obligor, individually and taken as a whole, to perform any of their respective Obligations under any of the Loan Documents to which it is a party; or
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:-6px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c) any material impairment of the validity,
binding effect or enforceability of this Credit Agreement or any of the other Loan Documents, or any material impairment of the rights, remedies or benefits available to the Administrative Agent or any Lender under any Loan Document. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Maximum Drawing Amount</U>. The maximum aggregate amount that the
beneficiaries may at any time draw under outstanding Letters of Credit, as such aggregate amount may be reduced from time to time pursuant to the terms of the Letters of Credit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Non-Extension Notice Date</U>. See &#167;4.2. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Notes</U>. The Revolving Credit Notes. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Note Record</U>. A Record with respect to a Note. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Obligations</U>. All indebtedness, obligations and liabilities of any of BGI, Barnes Switzerland, and any of their
Subsidiaries, as the case may be, including, without limitation, the Barnes Switzerland Obligations, to any of the Lenders and the Administrative Agent, individually or collectively, existing on the date of this Credit Agreement or arising
thereafter, direct or indirect, joint or several, absolute or contingent, matured or unmatured, liquidated or unliquidated, secured or unsecured, arising by contract, operation of law or otherwise, arising or incurred under this Credit Agreement or
any of the other Loan Documents or in respect of any of the Loans made or Reimbursement Obligations incurred or any of the Notes, Letter of Credit Application, Letter of Credit or other instruments at any time evidencing any thereof. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Operating Accounts</U>. See &#167;2.6.2. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Participant</U>. See &#167;15.4. </FONT></P> <P
